website_summaries.verdict: The BenQ XL2720T is a full featured 27-inch gaming monitor that delivers blazing pixel response, sharp colors, and inky blacks. It's a bit pricey but it offers every video input you'll need and is packed with features.

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, note that it's not the XL2720TX so no built-in 3D emitter.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to discover that this is not the one with a built in IR emitter for Nvidia 3D Vision, that's the XL2720TX. Otherwise it's great, some fiddling with display settings is required as they make it possible to have it brighter for the 3D part.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: BenQ XL2720T review.
customer_reviews.text: After having a computer that supports 1080p without a monitor I felt it was only right to get one. Since I primarily use my PC for gaming I chose this one as it is specifically designed for gaming. But it already has a stuck pixel after about a month and a half. I was kind of annoyed but it doesn't bother me too much really. Good monitor, nice picture and really good interface for changing your colour settings.
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Get one...NOW!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is perfect for any type of gamer! Picture quality and performance is 5*, not seen or used anything better then this! Colours are vibrant and the picture is sharp. Simple to use interface and sleek design. Great base stand, very sturdy and can flip the monitor landscape/portrait, raise/lower it on the stand, and angle the monitor in any way you wish to suit you.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Holdsworth

customer_reviews.title: Sent WRONG monitor (Worse Monitor)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this monitor thinking they'd send me the XL2720T when in fact they sent me a Firmware v1 XL2720Z (which is plagued with visual problems and it 10 times worse than the XL2720T) The only way for me to fix the XL2720Z Firmware v1 problem is by buying a piece of kit that costs upwards of £70.... just to update the Firmware to v2 pffft.
customer_reviews.author: Kingz

customer_reviews.title: Great expectations;
customer_reviews.text: Packed with great features such as USB ports, S-switch and the ability to rotate & view from almost any angle, this is a fabulous widescreen monitor that looks impressive ... until you turn it on! Yes it's ideal for gaming & 3D display but try as i might, i cannot get happy with the overall display quality. I was expecting a vibrant, sharp and crystal clear display in all modes but sadly, it's dull & lifeless. For around £350 i was expecting some 'WOW factor' when viewing. Probably my last BENQ
customer_reviews.author: dougiemuir

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my loved one. We are both active gamers and this monitor was the perfect gift. A product I would recommend to anyone looking for gaming monitor.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 120hz lcd once calibrated
customer_reviews.text: Very nice 120hz LCD, I bought 3 for a triple screen set up. Pre set picture values are terrible out of the box, but once calibrated (google search for settings) they look fantastic.
